characters: THE SMILING FACE OF HARRISON CAMBELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan WAKES with a start to find himself in the back seat He takes a moment to get his bearings, obviously rattled the odd dream. The Middle Eastern CABBIE stares through t partition at hin.

dialogues.speaker: CABBIE
dialogues.text: You get out here, yes?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Oh... Yeah. Sorry. I haven't been sleeping much lately and... Sorry. He pulls a couple BILLS out of his wallet and hands them the Cabbie. Climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan, still reeling from the dream, stands on this busy sidewalk, orienting himself. He looks up at a stately old apartment building, then down at a BUS ROARING past. Some has plastered a CAMPAIGN POSTER on the side -- The smilin face of HARRISON CAMBELL. (The guy Ethan just saw in the flying dream) Underneath it reads, "Harrison Cambell -- S Senate -- For A New Tomorrow". Ethan stares for a beat, then starts towards the entrance the apartment building. He STOPS. Looks down at a COCKROA crossing his path. Fascinated by it, he watches as it CRA to the gutter and into DRAINAGE GRATE, and --

dialogues.speaker: SURESH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Man is a narcissistic species by nature.

dialogues.speaker: THAT SAME COCKROACH
dialogues.text: Or at least one that LOOKS LIKE IT, crawls out of a crack the wall and scurries along the floor.

dialogues.speaker: A HAND
dialogues.text: reaches INTO FRAME and PICKS IT UP. WIDEN to meet Profess MOHINDER SURESH, (mid-30's), a slightly nerdy Bast Indian academician, standing in at the front of this LECTURE HAL in an old, faded British colonial building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 A CHIRON tells us this is "THE UNIVERSITY OF MADRAS, INDI

dialogues.speaker: SURESH
dialogues.text: But we are not the pinnacle of so-called evolution. Behind him, he's written his lecture in HINDI on the blackboard. (All but one word in English - “'TERAFORMA” . He lets the COCKROACH crawl along the back of his hand as speaks to a pathetically small group of FIVE STUDENTS scattered among the empty seats in this large classroom.

dialogues.speaker: SURESH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That honor belongs to the lowly cockroach. A creature who has adapted and evolved for 250 million years. Capable of living for months without food. Remaining alive headless for weeks at a time. As Suresh speaks, he looks up to see --

dialogues.speaker: THE DEAN
dialogues.text: an elderly Brahmin, standing at the back of the class. Su is little flustered by his presence. He continues --

dialogues.speaker: SURESB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Its female need only be impregnated once to Lay over a million eggs in her lifetime. Resistant to radiation, it is the only species who will survive a nuclear winter. If God has indeed created himself in his own image, then I submit to you that God is a cockroach. The class stares at him, unsure what to make of this stra pronouncement. The Dean nods, unamused. He CLAPS his hand LOUD, twice, to get everyone's attention.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You are all dismissed. This class has been canceled. The five students stand, a little confused and shuffle ou as the Dean approaches Professor Suresh. (Their conversat is in HINDI with English subtitles.)

dialogues.speaker: SURESH
dialogues.text: Sir, I know the enrollment is down a little this semester, but --

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I'm afraid this institution can no longer support your tenure, Dr. Suresh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: SURESH
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You are being dismissed from the faculty.

dialogues.speaker: SURESH
dialogues.text: what?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Your theories are unfounded.

dialogues.speaker: SURESH
dialogues.text: {a body blow) But...this is my life's work! fhe truth is, no one believes in your work and no one wants to publish your theories.

dialogues.speaker: SURESH
dialogues.text: BUT IT'S HAPPENING now! The world needs to know!

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I'm... sorry. Our decision is final. and off Suresh's stunned look -~

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: professor Suresh comes up the staircase of this four stor walk-up carrying his briefcase and 4 net bag full of groceries. He moves to his door, fumbles for his key, the STOPS. Something is wrong. Very wrong. It's the door. It's OPEN a tiny crack. suresh goes into FULL PANIC MODE. This is something he ha dreaded, but hasn't fully prepared for. “Think, think..." He gathers his courage and GENTLY PUSHES the door open fa enough to see inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the place is TORN APART. His gaze MOVES to a HUGE MAP OF HE WORLD taking up an entire wail. The map has dozens of COLORED PUSH PINS placed into different locations around world. A SHADOW washes over it. shit, someone's in there} suresh pulls back, leans against the wall. Breathes. Forc himself to think. Then, steeling himself, he pushes open the door and slinks into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark, cluttered two room apartment. Stacks of BOOKS and RESEARCH. The home of an obsessive, single-minded academi Suresh slinks to a desk, quietly tries to open a drawer. Shit, it's STUCK. He PULLS hard and the desk shakes as th drawer POPS OPEN. Something falis off the desk and lands his feet. A paix of HORNED RIMMED GLASSES. He picks them up. Looks at them curiously. These are clearly NOT HIS. Q.S. we HEAR someone RANSACKING the adjacent room. He sets the glasses back down and reaches into the drawer Pulls out a small CAMERA. Aims it at the map on the wali. SNAPS a photo. The FLASH GOES OFF! Shit. He cringes, as the 0.8. RANSACKING suddenly STOPS. They've noticed. Suresh RUSHES up to the map, reaches up and pulls out a W PUSH PIN that's right over MANHATTAN, turns and SPRINTS o of the apartment. And one second later, the FIGURE of a MAN, STEPS INTO the FOREGROUND. Stands here, taking in the room, his BACK TO us. Cold, calculating. We DO NOT see the man's face, but he reaches down and picks up the HORN RIMMED GLASSES, sli them on. Steps up to the map on the wall. Studies it, sensing that something's different. We PUSH RIGHT PAST him and onto a PUSH PIN inserted into the map right over the central par of NEVADA, . As we PUSH IN farther, Nevada MORPHS to the WHITE SAND of SATELLITE IMAGE over the entire state. We SLAM IN, RACING DOWN as DETAIL begins to emerge ~- The city of LAS VEGAS past the strip and INTO THE SUBURBS ~ Where we finally co to a STOP over a the rooftop of a small TRACT HOUSE, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they slide slowly, sexily off a woman's shapely REAR E WIDEN to find NIKI SANDERS, (33), showgirl looks, complet NAKED (strategically posed), holding the panties teasingl in front of her. She COOS and makes a pouty, sexy face. The CHIRON says, "LAS VEGAS, NEVADA". We PULL FURTHER back to see her posed on a BED with a blu satin bedspread. Shiny gold curtains hang behind the bed. FURTHER BACK now and we realize that we are in a GARAGE. This is a SET. Niki is performing for a WEBCAM on a tripo A cable stretches from the camera to a COMPUTER on a DESK  HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 Niki slips on a tiny silk robe and crosses to the compute Types quickly.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: we see the words, "Time's up", The CURSOR BLINKS as it wa for a response. A beat, then we see the response, “Just a little more. Please. I'm almost there." Niki's answers this by typing -- "It'll cost you another bucks." Niki waits for the response. The BLINKING CURSOR, then --

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Creep. She turns and heads for the door, but stops. An odd look her face. A little scared. She whips around, as though expecting someone to be there. She stares across the room at a MIRROR. Her own REFLECTION stares back. Something about it disturbs her. She backs slowly to the door that leads into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny cracker box of a house. Niki makes her way down th narrow hallway, stepping over a baseball glove.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Time to wake up, Micah! She comes to a stop at a bedroom doorway. Looks into -~

dialogues.speaker: MICAH'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: The domain of a messy ten year old boy. The bed is unmade but Micah is nowhere to be seen. (NOTE: We see Niki's REFLECTION in a MIRROR on the back of the door. Her profi Niki stares at the empty bed. Then suddenly a little panicked, as a terrible thought dawns on her --

dialogues.speaker: NIKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Micah! She turns and hurries down the hall. But as she does, her REFLECTION in the mirror SP! SECOND LO! than she did. This is barely perceptible and a little wei

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 Niki stops, looks. Tacky furnishings, no frills. These ar people living at the bottom of the American dream.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Micah! She heads into --

dialogues.speaker: THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: where we see MICAH, (10), of mixed race, half black, sitt at the small table eating a bowl of FRUIT LOOPS, as he examines a SHOE BOX next to him. He looks up innocently.

dialogues.speaker: MICAH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: (relieved) Dammit, Micah, don't do that to me.

dialogues.speaker: MICAH
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just... You need to be careful, that's all. I don't want you talking to any strangers, you understand? Whoa, where's this coming from?

dialogues.speaker: MICAH
dialogues.text: I'm just having breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: That's not breakfast. That stuff'1l rot your brain. Micah just goes back to work on the SHOE BOX, poking a wh into the lid with a pen.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MICAH
dialogues.text: Making a pinhole camera... It's for the eclipse, (off her confused look) The moon's gonna cover up the sun today. We're supposed to look at it at school.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Speaking of which, go get ready. We can’t be late. Not today.  HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: MICAH
dialogues.text: I'm already dressed and packed my own lunch, (pointed) That's what I've been doing this morning. What about you?

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Hey, don't get smart with me. I've been working to Pay our bills!

dialogues.speaker: MICAH
dialogues.text: Then why'd they turn off our gas again? She doesn't have a comeback for that,

dialogues.speaker: MICAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why can't you go back to work at the casino? You made a lot of money there.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Because I can't, alright. and you're not the adult here, I am.

dialogues.speaker: MICAH
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Yeah, sure you are. Before she can respond, the DOORBELL RINGS. Niki stops. A panicked look crosses her face.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: (ominous ) Grab your stuff and wait by the back door.

dialogues.speaker: MICAH
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Just do it! Niki turns and heads into ~-

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: where she crosses to the window and pulls back the curtai

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Two MEN stand at her front door. One is a little WEASEL o a GUY in a tight LEATHER JACKET. The other is BIG, And I mean big. The weasel is slipping on a pair of leather glo Trust me, it's not that cold outside,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE “Genesis" 12/2/05 9. Niki shuts the curtain. Eyes wide. The DOORBELL RINGS aga Shit.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BACK DOOR
dialogues.text: Niki, now in a bra and shimmying into a pair of jeans, . wrestles a t-shirt over her head as she meets up with Mic He waits with his backpack. And now he's scared,

dialogues.speaker: MICAH
dialogues.text: Mom, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Nevermind, just keep your voice down and stay close to me. They head out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FENCE, as Niki and Micah drop over it and SCURRY QUICKL to an old DATSON B210 parked at the curb. Micah JUMPS into the passenger side. Niki unhooks the WIR that's holding the driver's side door shut and climbs in. In a billow of EXHAUST SMOKE, the car lurches, then FISHT down the street. We RISE UP as it disappears around the corner and ~-

dialogues.speaker: INT, NIKI SANDERS' LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: WHAM! The front door SPLINTERS off its hinges! KICKED ope The WEASEL and the BIG GUY step into the room, taking it As they move off to search the Place --

dialogues.speaker: FADE OUT
dialogues.text: INT. BEDROOM - PENTHOUSE APARTMENT — DAY 10 And FADE IN on ETHAN (our guy with the flying dream) lean against the headboard of a big bed, reading aloud from th New York Times stock page. A HEADLINE on the folded page facing us reads: "Skies Clear for Solar Eclipse". On the bed, next to Ethan, an OLD MAN, (83), thin, frail, lies dying, a breathing tube in his nose. Ethan is a hosp nurse, hence the uniform. A warm and gentle soul, selfles almost a saint. We're on the 3lst floor of the stately old apartment that saw earlier. A CHIRON Says, "UPPER EAST SIDE, MANHATT: me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 10.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: (reading) "amCor sold at 68 and a half. GenCom was down two to fifteen and an eighth." That's sounds like a bargain to me,

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: (painful, barely audible) Money... Shit. The goddamn hippies had it right. In the end it's only love that matters.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: I'd like to think so.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: I'm... (can't find the word)

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Thirsty. Here. He takes a glass of water from the night stand, tips it g into the Old Man's mouth. He swallows painfully.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: How do you do that... know what I want before I say it? Ethan just smiles warmly at him.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going to be dead soon,

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: (matter-of-fact) I know.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: I want to do it right. Make it worth something.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: I think it's about letting go.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: I know. But how?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Look out the window there. see how beautiful it is today? He gestures to a large open window. Lace curtains billow the sunny breeze, Outside, a MAGNIFICENT MANHATTAN SKYLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 qi.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's freedom out there. Peace. No more pain, no more IV's. When you're ready, just let yourself go there. Let yourself... fly.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: Can you show me? Ethan looks at him, a little confused.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you show me how? Ethan stares at him, then nods. He stands and turns towar the window. Starts walking slowly towards it, picking up speed. And just as we think he's about to JUMP OUT --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan WAKES, still on the bed, the New York Times resting his chest. The Old Man next to him lies UNCONSCIOUS. Etha looks up to see STELLA, (28), beautiful, bohemian, in a colorful cotton dress. She's the Old Man's daughter.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, did I scare you?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: No, it's just... I keep having these weird dreams every time I close my eyes... (re: the newspaper) He likes me to read him the stock page.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Has he been conscious?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: No. Been nine days now. I think he's close. Couple days maybe. Stella nods, fighting her emotions.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: I don't know what he'd do without you, Ethan. You've got a real gift.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: dust doing my job.  12 HEROES VOLUME ONE “Genesis” 12/2/05 12.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: No, you're like a son to him. Ethan smiles, a little embarrassed --

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Then that would make us like brother and sister. Could be a little awkward if I ever wanted to ask you out. And now it's Stella who looks at him embarrassed. He was serious and they both realize it. He's got a crush on her And why not? So do we.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, that was really inappropriate.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: No, you're sweet. It’s just... I'm kinda seeing somebody and-~

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's okay, really. (excusing himself) I've gotta change his Iv... As he walks off, Stella sits next to her father. Ethan wa towards the WINDOW that he flew out of in his dream. It's CLOSED, CURTAINS DRAWN. As he stops and stares at it, the sight of it upsetting him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in REAL TIGHT on the FACE of D.L. HAWKINS, (31). A white man's nightmare, D.L. is a black man doing life in prison with nothing to lose and mean as hell. But right now, he's as peaceful as a baby -- sound ASLEEP on the fl The CHIRON says, "SING SING PRISON, NEW Yt a 0.S. we hear DOGS BARKING and FOOTSTEPS approaching. Both are growing LOUDER. And as they become DEAFENING -- D.L.' eyes SNAP open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four ROTTWEILERS tug at their leashes pulling a posse of PRISON GUARDS, loaded for bear with SHOTGUNS and RIFLES. D.L. sits up quickly and scoots back on his hands to a wa

dialogues.speaker: FREEZE
dialogues.text: The dogs are taut on their leashes, inches away from ripp him apart, TEETH FLARING, DROOL FLYING. He's SCARED SHITL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 13.

dialogues.speaker: PRISON GUARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How did you get out of your cell?! D.L. just looks around, thoroughly confused.

dialogues.speaker: PRISON GUARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How the fuck did you get out of your goddamn cell?! DL. I don't... I don't know. And he's dead serious. He really has no idea.

dialogues.speaker: THE SMILING FACE OF HARRISON CAMBELL
dialogues.text: WIDEN to find this image is one of several CAMPAIGN POSTE plastered on the window of a storefront campaign headquar Ethan heads towards the entrance, but stops as a WAVE OF PEOPLE head out, making their way towards two BLACK EXPEDITIONS parked at the curb. HARRISON CAMBELL, (34), Ethan's fraternal twin brother, dressed in an Armani suit, turns and sees Ethan. Where Et is a lost dreamer, Harrison is a golden boy. A star. A look of trepidation crosses his face and he hurries over see Ethan.

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: I've got two speeches and a fund raiser. I'm late...

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: It happened two more times. And you were in both of them.

dialogues.speaker: EARRISON
dialogues.text: I can't do this, Ethan. Not now.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: They're not just dreams, Harrison. They're too real, What if they're telling me something?

dialogues.speaker: RARRISON
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Telling you what?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: What if they're telling me I can fly? There. He said it. Harrison looks at him like he's nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3 HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis” 12/2/05 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly desperate) When I got out of bed this morning, my foot hovered before it hit the floor for a split second. Like I was floating. It's so real I'm afraid to go to sleep. Harrison grabs him and pulls him against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: You need to snap the fuck out of this, you understand?! Go see a doctor, get some drugs. Just don't go pulling a Roger Clinton on me. I've got ten days left and I'm two points down.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: I know, I know. I'm sorry. It's just... I have a feeling you're the only one who understands this.

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: (pissed) Why?! Why the hell would I understand that you think you can fly?! ee ETHAN Because you're my twin brother! We shared a womb-- Harrison's cell phone RINGS, interrupting. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: (to phone) Mom. I can't talk... What? Where? I'll be there in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: What is it? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: (stunned) Mom just got arrested.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Arrested for what?

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: Shoplifting. @ Off the two of them, what the hell? ~- é

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14 HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BUCKET of PAINT is tossed onto a PAINTING, destroying w is a brilliant PHOTO-REALIST image of a PLANE CRASHING in a BRIDGE. PULL BACK to meet ISAAC BOROLO, (28), a wiry, handsome, b strung-out junkie. Black jeans, a "Being John Malkovitch" shirt, barefoot, with a five-day growth on his face. We're not sure what's going on with him, but he's frantic about something and having a REALLY BAD DAY. we're in a huge ARTIST'S LOFT with tin foil covering the large windows. Only tiny CRACKS of SUNLIGHT seep through. The CHIRON reads, “LOWER EAST SIDE, MANHATTAN". Isaac pul another painting from a stack against the wall. Another photo-realist image - this one of a BUILDING BURNING. Isaac grabs the bucket of paint and rears back to toss it

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (0.5S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?! He stops and turns to see STELLA (the old dying man's daughter) standing in the doorway, sunlight silhouetting her, one hand leaning on the doorjamb. He fills the bucket up with more paint. She approaches. Pissed, confused -~

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you high?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: No. Yes. I don't know. He tosses paint on ANOTHER PAINTING. This one has the ima of a TOTAL ECLIPSE OF THE SUN.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Would you stop! What are you, crazy?!

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Clearly.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: You're chasing, aren't you? He looks at her. Whatever that means, he's verified it wi his silence. She moves to the destroyed paintings. Looks at them like they're dead kittens.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When did you do these? 15. 14

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 He doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are fantastic. There's enough here for a show. JI can call Arni, he can get you gallery space...

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Not I can't.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Why not?!

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Because I don't even remember doing them. I can only paint when I'm high.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. We'll get you back into a program. It'll work this time.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: They're evil.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? He angrily crosses the paintings. Lifts one from the stac It's big, five feet wide. A photo-realism image of THREE RACE HORSES crossing a finish line.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: This horse? Name is Applejax. This is him winning the Santa Anita Derby in the sixth race. I painted it three weeks ago. Stella stares at it, confused.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Yeah? So? Isaac strides over to a table. Picks up a NEWSPAPER. Flip through it. Shoves a page right into her face. Stella stares, confused. And now WE SEE the page. It's a PHOTOGR in the Sports Section. It's the IDENTICAL IMAGE.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: That's this morning's paper. The race was yesterday. Fucking yesterday! Stella just blinks, trying to process what he's getting a

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: But that's... 16.  HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Impossible? Apparently not.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: You telling me you can paint the future? Isaac doesn't answer. Just fills the bucket again.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's just a coincidence. You were high. For all you know you could've painted it this morning. Isaac angrily pulls out another PAINTING from the stack.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: No. This one I painted this morning! He spins it around for us to see. The image is of Stella STANDING IN THE DOORWAY wearing the same flowery dress. T EXACT IMAGE we first saw of her -- Sunlight silhouetting from behind, one hand leaning on the doorjamb above her h She stares at it, now a little freaked.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Something's. Wrong. With me.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: (desperate) We'll get you help, Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I've tried that. Twice. There's only one way left.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: You can't do that. Not alone. I can help you. I love you. Please.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: NO! I'll drag you down with me, I swear to God I will. dust leave me alone. (off her stare) Get out of here! NOW! Stella holds his gaze. What she gets for falling in love with a junkie. She neds and slowly backs away, turns and walks out. Isaac watches her. Then stares at the painting A moment of decision. He's got a plan and he's sticking t it. He crosses quickly to a desk. YANKS open a drawer and pulls out a ROLLED UP t-shirt. Unrolls it onto the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 Inside is FIX KIT - a SYRINGE, a SPOON, a BURNER, a BAG O HEROIN. Another drawer YANKS open and he reaches in, pull out a pair of HANDCUFFS. Strides to the middle of the roo Lays the fix kit down on the floor, opens it. He walks back to the wall, sits, crosses his legs. Takes ONE END of the handcuffs and SNAPS them onto his WRIST. Takes THE OTHER END and SNAPS it onto the RADIATOR. He stares at the heroin, ten feet away. So close, but now impossible to get to. Off his steely determination --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking at a SHAKY HOME VIDEO IMAGE of CLAIRE BENNE (17), standing on the edge of a TWO HUNDRED FOOT CLIFF at rock quarry, staring over the precipice. Claire has "girl next-door" looks, and to complete the cliché, she's dress in a CHEERLEADING OUTFIT. A CHIRON prints out across the screen -- "ODESSA, TEXAS". Claire's life up until now has been as ordinary as any ki in rural America. But right now it's anything but ordinar Because at this moment, her arms outstretch and she leans forward and... steps off the ledge. Like she's flying. Except she's NOT flying. She's FALLING. And fast! We watc this horrible incident like a bad “shock video” TV moment Until SPLAT! She hits the ground FULL FORCE. It's fucking awful. The CAMERA runs up to her, like assassination footage. We hear the LABORED BREATHING of whoever is shooting this vi footage. The CAMERA stops and aims down at her BROKEN, {JWISTED body. BLOOD on the rocks. A long beat, then Claire begins to STIR. Slowly. She POPS her dislocated leg BACK INTO ITS SOCKET. Her joints SQUIS and SNAP into place. ‘Then she pries her bloody face off rock and looks right INTO CAMERA --

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: This is Claire Bennet... and that was attempt number six. And off her placid expression --

dialogues.text: that reads 1:47. The SWEEP HAND TICKS off the seconds rhythmically. Tick, tick, tick... ADJUST to see HIRO TANAKA, (24), staring at the clock intensely. He's two feet away from it, his stare practica poring a hole into it. His face is actually shaking, he's concentrating so hard on it. WIDEN to find Hiro at his cluttered desk in a tiny OFFICE CUBICLE, the walls covered with JAPANESE ANIME CHARACTERS pinned to every surface. The CHIRON says, “TOKYO, JAPAN". Hiro is slight and nondescript in his short white sleeve shirt and black tie. A worker bee in sea of worker bees. However, Hiro has a hint of the nonconformist in him. A little "spike" to his hairstyle. His tie a little too thi A small "punk" bracelet tucking out of his sleeve. We HOLD on him, as his fervent stare intensifies on the c eyes bulging, forehead sweating. And then... miraculously

dialogues.text: STOPS! QUIVERS and CLICKS ONE SECOND BACK - before resumi its normal forward rhythm. Hiro THRUSTS both fists into the air.

dialogues.speaker: BONSAI
dialogues.text: He leaps out of his chair and lunges out of the cubicle. TRACK WITH him as he SPRINTS down the long aisle, past wh seems like a hundred other cubicles in this bee hive of workers.

dialogues.speaker: A COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: A live VIDEO IMAGE of Niki (our webcam stripper) slipping into her tiny robe. She's on the SET in her garage-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 (This is the VERY SAME scene we saw earlier). Niki walks past the camera, leaving just the image of the empty bed. Under which, we see the words, "Time's up" typ out across the COMPUTER SCREEN. WIDEN to meet ANDO MASAHASHI, (28), a little more conserv looking than Hiro, and frankly a bit of a killjoy. Where Hiro's cubicle was a cluttered mess, Ando's is exemplary its neatness. Ando types his response to Niki. “Just a little more. Please. I'm almost there." The CURSOR BLINKS, then Niki's response, "It'll cost you another 39 bucks...." Ando stares at the BLINKING CURSOR, then types “BITCH!” Just then, Hiro SLIDES around a corner and into the cubic Ando quickly hits a button on he keyboard - A SCREEN SAVE for "Star Wars - Revenge Of The Sith” takes over the scre Hiro catches his breath for a beat, before -- (Their conversation is in Japanese - subtitled to English.)

dialogues.speaker: HIRO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I did it! I did it!

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: (impatient) What now?

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: I've broken the space/time continuum!

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: (thoroughly uninterested) Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: My clock. I made it go back one second, using only my mind, my thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: Too bad you're not paid by the hour. You'd be onto something.

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: I'm serious. This explains the subway this morning.

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: It was fourteen seconds late. Big deal.

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: (for the 10th time) That train is never late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 21.

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: (humoring him) Until you made it late... using only your mind.

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: yes. I have discovered powers beyond any mere mortal.

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: Right. You and Spock.

dialogues.speaker: BIRO
dialogues.text: (finally, you get it) Yes. Like Spock. Exactly. Suddenly, Hiro is grabbed by the scruff of his shirt. It' his BOSS, who starts YELLING at him as he drags him away. We're not sure what he's yelling, but we can guess it has something to do with getting his ass back to work. Ando pokes his head out of his cubicle and watches with a smile as Hiro is dragged humiliatingly away -~

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: (yelling after) Use your ‘death grip', Spock! The ‘death grip’! Off Ando, laughing at his friend --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF TENNIS SHOED FEET swing nonchalantly. WIDEN to find Micah by himself in this sterile waiting room, bored He looks up to see his mom, Niki, THROUGH THE GLASS WALL the Principal's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Niki sits across the desk from PRINCIPAL KEARNS, a tweedy hippie. Beard, corduroy jacket. Niki is pretty agitated, and this conversation isn't helping matters.

dialogues.speaker: KEARNS
dialogues.text: I'd like to tell you it's only his test scores, but it's pervasive.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: He's just a little behind though, right? And she barely contains her desperation. Kearns just hold her gaze, not giving in. She lowers her voice -~

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: NIKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, I'm a single mom and I work nights a lot, but... he can work harder at it... we both can.

dialogues.speaker: KEARNS
dialogues.text: It's not just hard work, there are basic developmental issues at play here. I'm afraid he's just not a good fit here.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: (stunned) But... He's made friends. He's on the soccer team.

dialogues.speaker: KEARNS
dialogues.text: People pay a lot of money to send their children to this school...

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Yeah, well so do I!

dialogues.speaker: KEARNS
dialogues.text: They expect an academic standard that we simply cannot fall below. We don’t have the resources to deal with your son's special--

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: I wrote a check for twenty five thousand dollars to get him into this snobfestl I was told that's what it took! Not to mention the fourteen grand a year for tuition! In the b.g., Micah has noticed things heating up in here. Kearns

dialogues.speaker: KEARNS
dialogues.text: And your donation was very appreciated.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Well I want it back. just looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want it back now. Preferably in cash.

dialogues.speaker: KEARNS
dialogues.text: That donation went into the capital campaign for the new wing. It's already been spent.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Then un-spend it!  19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 23.

dialogues.speaker: KEARNS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. We can certainly discuss a partial refund of this year's tuition. Niki reaches across the desk and GRABS him by the collar, HOISTS him out of his seat.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Fuck you, I want my money back!

dialogues.speaker: KEARNS
dialogues.text: That's... not possible. Niki, seething, shoves him back into his chair --

dialogues.speaker: INT, WAITING ROOM
dialogues.text: Kearn's office door FLIES open and Niki strides out. Kear stands in the b.g. Niki grabs Micah by the hand.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Come on, let's get outta here. (looking back at Kearns) You're too good for this lousy school. She pulls Micah towards the door, but passes a MIRROR alo the way. She catches her REFLECTION in it. Stops. Looks at herself. Something about it pisses her off. She strides up to the mirror, stares. Then rears her hand pack. And just as she's about to strike her palm into the glass - her REFLECTION SLIDES UP and OUT of the frame. WHAM! She SHATTERS the empty mirror with her palm. Then follows the trajectory of WHERE THE REFLECTION WENT. she stares up at the corner of the ceiling at something we CA see. A long and strange beat, as everyone stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: MICAH
dialogues.text: (concerned) Mom?

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: (at something unseen)

dialogues.speaker: LEAVE ME ALONE
dialogues.text: Niki shields Micah behind her and backs away, opening the office door and rushing off with her son in tow. Off Kear what the hell was that all about --?  20

We TILT DOWN of the 7-ELEVEN SIGN to find Claire, still in her cheerleadi outfit, sitting on the curb next to 2Z0E, (16), a kind of artsy looking gawky kid holding a VIDEO CAMERA at her sid while drinking a slurpee. Claire has her chin on her knees, staring out at nothing. She's completely cleaned up from her fall, looks normal.

dialogues.text: I am so depressed.

dialogues.text: why? Claire turns and gives her one of those teenager looks.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Besides the fact that it was so gross I almost fudged myself, this is the single coolest thing to happen in this town in like a hundred years.

dialogues.text: Not if nobody finds out, it isn't.

dialogues.text: Then why'd you want me to tape it?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I have my reasons.

dialogues.speaker: 20E
dialogues.text: I still can't believe you asked me. You stopped talking to me in sixth grade.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Safer this way.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Why, cuz I'm not popular and no one would believe me even if I did tell, which I won't?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.text: I mean, it's not like you're not going be popular anymore.  HEROES VOLUME ONE “Genesis” 12/2/05

dialogues.text: (snaps) Popular?! Who's talking about popular?! My life as I know it, is over, okay?! I've got the Bishop game next week, the SAT's in October, homecoming's three weeks from today, and I am a freak show!

dialogues.text: No! I don't think. Look at me. I busted like every bone in my body, stabbed myself in the chest, shoved a two foot steel rod through my neck and there's not a scratch on me.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Then what do you call that? Zoe points down to Claire's leg. Claire looks down to see bloody, horrific COMPOUND FRACTURE POKING through her SHI It's almost too gross and bloody to look at.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (only slightly annoyed) Great... Claire reaches down and POPS the bone back into her flesh It makes a SICKENING SOUND as it SNAPS into place. She lo back up at Zoe -~

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just give me the tape, okay? She holds out her hand, impatiently snaps her fingers. Z0 relents. Opens the camera, pulls out the tiny digital CASSETTE and hands it to her. Claire stands and starts to walk off, limping slightly. Z watches her.

dialogues.text: You don't want a ride?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: No. I‘m just gonna walk. Then Claire stops. Turns and looks back at Zoe. Softens -

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks, okay? I'11 talk to you in front of people at school tomorrow. I promise.

INTERROGATION ROOM - POLICE PRECINCT - DAY al ALICE CAMBELL, (76), sits with her purse in her lap at a tiny interrogation table. Don't let her sweet appearance fool you, this is a formidable woman, in this incongruous setting. A UNIFORM COP lets Ethan and Harrison into the room then leaves. Alice looks up at them, shrugs sheepish

dialogues.text: Mom, for God sakes...

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: They dropped the charges. I have to fill out a form. It's no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: No big deal?! Do you have any idea what this'll do to me if it gets out?! And what could you possibly need so badly that you had to steal it?! (then, disgusted) Nevermind! I don't even wanna know.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Socks.

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: What?! Jesus! Dad left you a fortune. What were you thinking?! Are you sick? Delusional?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: (snaps) Leave her alone! She's okay, that's all that matters.

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: Oh sure, our mom is a criminal, but thank God she's fine. Next thing we know she'll be telling us she's a crack whore. {starts pacing) I've gotta keep this outa the press.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: You know what? Get outa here! Just go worry about your image! I'll handle this.

dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 27.

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: I'm gonna call the D.A.'s office, make sure this thing is buried. And Harrison strides out of the room, leaving Ethan and A to look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: (sweetly) What were you thinking, mom?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I just wanted to feel alive again. Off Ethan, nodding, he understands --

dialogues.text: of a COCKROACH. We TILT OFF it to find this tattoo on D.L Hawkins’ RIGHT ARM. He's sitting in the only chair in thi cement room. Stares straight ahead. The WARDEN, an intens WOMAN in a SUIT paces in front of him, looking at a file. Two GUARDS stand nearby.

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN
dialogues.text: You're doing two consecutive life terms, Mr. Hawkins. Might as well be dog years. And since you're going to be here a while, it would be wise for us to build a little trust. D.L. says nothing. Just stares straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In 2002 we installed a pneumatic lock- down system. State of the art, four fail safe backups. Your cell was locked up tighter than a cat's butt last night. So I'm gonna ask you one more time -- How did you get out? D.L. just looks at her. She crosses and stands right in front of him, leans in close to his face.

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I didn't catch that. DL. (calmly) I told you, I just woke up there. The Warden sighs. Thinks a bit.  HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN
dialogues.text: (to Guards) Transfer him to Unit 9. As the guards move towards D.L., another GUARD steps into the room and approaches the Warden -- WHISPERS in her ear She looks up at D.L. as he's being led out the door.

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mr. Hawkins. D.L. turns,

dialogues.speaker: WARDEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Seems you have a phone call. Which for some reason I feel inclined to let you take. (then) Don't mistake this for a charitable gesture. I just happen to believe in the importance of family. And she walks away. Off D.L.‘s confused eyes -~

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FINGER RINGS a DOORBELL and we WIDEN to find Niki stand with Micah at the front door of a small tract house.

dialogues.speaker: MICAH
dialogues.text: I hate it here. She doesn't even have a TV...

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: I'll be right back. I'm just gonna pack up some stuff and we'll leave tonight, go visit your dad--

dialogues.text: Is someone trying to hurt us? Niki looks at him. Kneels to his eye level.

dialogues.text: I made some mistakes, I admit it.

dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Nevermind. But you have to understand, I'd never let anything happen to you, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: MICAH
dialogues.text: Why'd you break that mirror, mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 A beat, as Niki tries to think of how to answer. Before s can, the door opens, revealing TEXAS TINA, a tough former show girl, a half dozen years older than Niki. She sizes them up. Knows exactly why they're here.

dialogues.speaker: TEXAS TINA
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Couple hours, tops?

dialogues.speaker: TEXAS TINA
dialogues.text: (beat, to Micah) There's some ice-cream in the frige. Micah looks up at Niki for her approval. She nods and he rushes into the house, leaving Texas Tina and Niki starin at each other.

dialogues.speaker: TEXAS TINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: I needed money. I went to see Linderman.

dialogues.speaker: TEXAS TINA
dialogues.text: (shakes her head, disgusted) How much?

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Thirty.

dialogues.speaker: TEXAS TINA
dialogues.text: You gambling again?

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Wo. Just... bills and... Used the rest to get Micah into a private school. They wanted to hold him back another year at public school and... I just needed them to think we had the money.

dialogues.speaker: TEXAS TINA
dialogues.text: From a loan shark? Shit Niki, you weren't born yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: I'm two weeks overdue. I thought I could handle it... but... I'm under a lot of stress. e@ TEXAS TINA Gee, I wonder why.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: I'm starting to lose it a little. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: NIKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (lowers her voice) I'm seeing things.

dialogues.speaker: TEXAS TINA
dialogues.text: (suspicious) Like? Niki looks around, not sure how to say this. Then ~~

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: I keep feeling like someone's watching me.

dialogues.speaker: TEXAS TINA
dialogues.text: No shit, Sherlock. The dude wants his money back. He's sent some mouth breather to put you in the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: It's not just them. It’s someone else. Someone I can't see. Does that make any sense? fina just looks at her, confused.

dialogues.speaker: TEXAS TINA
dialogues.text: No, not much.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I shouldn't be telling you--

dialogues.speaker: TEXAS TINA
dialogues.text: But let me tell you what does makes sense. You have to come up with the thirty grand, plus interest, now. Or you gotta run. That's what makes sense. Off Niki's frightened stare, knowing what she has to do ~

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan and his mom, Alice, stroll down the shady sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: He only cares about himself.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Your father was the same way. Alpha dogs, both of them. You, in the meantime, for all your selflessness, sitting with dying people... You gonna retire on what you make?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll start shoplifting my socks.
24  VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Don't get smart. When you put everyone else first, you end up last. You always put Harrison first and he took advantage.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: He's my brother. I love him.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Love is overrated.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: And he loves me too. I know it. We've always been so close.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Rose colored glasses.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: That's cruel.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: It's the truth.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: We had our own language ‘til we were five.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Four. He stopped before you did.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: It's biological. I can't help it. I've always had this intense connection with him. (stops, looks at her) I've never told you this... But when Harrison had the accident... I knew it.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: We all got the same call.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: No. I mean I knew it before the call. Three hundred miles away, I woke up and I knew he'd been hurt. Alice just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know it's not right to be so connected @ to him. I'm meant for something special of my own. But when? é She stops and looks at him. There’s something cold in h eyes.  VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I'm your mother, and I love you. But the truth is, I gave up hope for you a long time ago. He just stares, crushed by these terrible words. She kiss him on the cheek and starts up the stairs of the brownsto Ethan leans back against the railing of the steps. Closes his eyes. We PUSH IN on him and WHOOSH -~

dialogues.text: We're suddenly in another (SUBJECTIVE CAMERA} FLYING DREA SOARING, SWOOPING, DIVING. Conner Oberst's (Bright Eyes) “Road to Joy” rises ONTO TBE SOUNDTRACK, as we TUMBLE, TW and ROLL. We BANK and start to RISE above the skyscrapers higher and higher until we reach ~-

dialogues.text: we're looking DOWN fifty OFFICE WORKERS doing CALISTHENIC in regimented unison. SIDE BENDS, DEEP KNEE BENDS, etc. I looks like a precision drill team. All but ONE LONE FIGUR whom we PICK OUT among the masses. It's HIRO. He's just standing there in the middle of the pack, staring up at t ECLIPSE. As the moon's SHADOW creeps over the rooftop --

dialogues.text: looking down at Isaac, our junkie artist, lying on the fl SHAKING violently. He looks awful, in full-blown WITHDRAW A STREAK of LIGHT cuts across his face, seeping in throug crack in the tin-foil covered windows. That light suddenly DARKENS, and in a moment of lucidity, Isaac looks up and focuses on the SUN as it's being obscu by the MOON. We DRIFT OFF of him, and --

dialogues.text: We're LOOKING DOWN at ETHAN hailing a taxi on a crowded corner. A TAXI slows to stop, as the sunlight around him begins to DARKEN. He climbs into the back of the taxi.

dialogues.speaker: THE TAXI'S REAR SIDE WINDOW
dialogues.text: as Ethan stares out of it, looking up at the sun we --
