dialogues.text: We TILT DOWN from the sky to a two story APARTMENT HOUSE FIRE. (This is the same image that we saw a painting of i Isaac's loft.) FIRE TRUCKS, POLICE, NEWS VAN, dozens of O LOOKERS behind a barricade across the street. We PAN their faces until we find CLAIRE, standing among t still in her cheerleading outfit. While everyone's eyes a glued to the burning building, Claire's gaze is skyward, squinting to look at the ECLIPSE. And as we RISE ABOVE he the SHADOW of the MOON washes over the entire scene and w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Guards lead D.L. down the long cell block, past cells with hardened looking CONVICTS. The LIGHT streaming throu the high windows suddenly DARKENS. D.L. seems to be the only one who notices. And when he does, it stops him in h tracks. It's as though it means something to him. And off his intense stare --

dialogues.speaker: FADE OUT AND INTO
dialogues.text: INT. NIKI SANDERS' LIVING ROOM —- DAY 31 Niki carefully enters through the SPLINTERED FRONT DOOR. edge, she COCKS HER HEAD to hear if anyone is in here. Ev step cautious, like walking on broken glass. She STOPS in the room, looking around. It's been RANSACKE Her gaze falls on the SHOE BOX (Micah's pinhole camera) o an end table, SUNLIGHT streaming down on it from the wind She crosses, picks it up. Lifts the lid, peeks inside --

dialogues.speaker: THE INSIDE OF THE BOX
dialogues.text: Through the pinhole -- An image of the NEARLY COMPLETE EC illuminates the bottom of the box. As CONNER OBERST'S “Ro To Joy" FADES OUT, Niki pulls her eye away from the box a sets it down. Then HEARS a NOISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 34. She SPINS around and sees the BIG GUY who busted down her door earlier. He's in the kitchen, his back to her. He clearly doesn‘t know she's here. She freezes. Shit. What should she do? She slowly starts to back towards the front door, when ~- she's GRABBED fro behind! She turns to see the Weasel looking guy.

dialogues.speaker: WEASEL
dialogues.text: Welcome home. And off Niki's fearful eyes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Dreamtime”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: CHAPTER THREE
dialogues.text: “Dreamtime”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been ONLY SECONDS since we last saw Claire. She lowe her gaze from the eclipse to the FIRE TRUCKS in the dista We notice a few PEOPLE, inconsolable, SOBBING, as some "l one" is clearly trapped in this building. Claire turns to look at a small cluster of FIREMEN and CO conferring nearby. Another COP rushes up to them. We can barely make out their conversation. coP #1 .--Four year old in a wheelchair. Lives in the middle apartment, second floor. They all glance up at the building.

dialogues.speaker: FIREMAN
dialogues.text: The staircase is gone, fire's taken out eighty percent of the top floor. They all stare, paralyzed by their impedance. Claire turns back, looks at the building. Then without mu thought, she climbs over the barricade and starts across street. We MOVE with her as she walks towards the buildin In the chaos, no one notices, until --

dialogues.speaker: FIREMAN
dialogues.text: HEY! What do you think you're doing?! But it's too late, Claire is almost to the entrance of th building. A NEWS CREW rushes forward, capturing her image just as she disappears INTO THE FLAMES. The Cops and Fire come rushing up, but there's nothing they can do but watc We MOVE IN on the building and HOLD for a long beat. And just when we're not sure where we go from here --

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: emerges from the FLAMES, carrying an UNCONSCIOUS FOUR YEA OLD BOY in her arms, her expression still blank. Two Fire run up to her. She hands over the boy, as the NEWS CREW rushes up to her, pointing their camera in her face. As w MOVE 360 degrees around her, we -~

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 36.

dialogues.speaker: AN OLD INSTITUTIONAL PHONE HANDSET
dialogues.text: is lifted off its wall-mounted receiver. We FOLLOW it UP a TIGHT CU of D.L. He's sitting in a Plexiglas booth, ina long row of other Plexiglas booths, each containing a PRI on the phone. D.L. Hello? We HEAR only HIS SIDE of the call as speaks softly--

dialogues.speaker: D.L., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah... (hard to say) I miss you too. (listens) When? Are you sure?... Did you see what they looked like?... As he listens, he lowers his head in defeated fatigue.

dialogues.speaker: D.L., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Iocan't... help you right now. You know that. So you need to listen to me. You gotta be the man for now. A man's got responsibilities. To his family. That's your job now. (more to himself) That's your job. He looks up as the Guard TAPS on the glass, “wrap it up”.

dialogues.speaker: D.L., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ZI gotta go. You and your mama are gonna be okay. Tell her I promise her something... (lowers his voice to a whisper) I'm gonna find a way outa here. And he slowly hangs up the phone. Blinks hard to clear th tears from his eyes and we -~ cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Micah, standing at the counter, slowly hangs up the phone There are tears in his eyes as well.

dialogues.speaker: TEXAS TINA, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Who were you talking to?  35 36

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 37. Micah turns, startled to see Texas Tina standing in the doorway. He hesitates, then --

dialogues.speaker: MICAH
dialogues.text: No one. off Texas Tina, not buying it -~

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiro and Ando stroll down the sidewalk. Hiro is all amped up. Ando the somber skeptic. (Again, their conversation i in Japanese.)

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: The Yogis in India have been doing this for thousands of years. ‘The Aborigines in Australia bend time and space when they enter the dreamtime.

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: Fine, I'll humor you. Let's say you really do have this power... What do you do with it? Join the circus? I mnean, no one ever got laid by stopping the second hand of a clock.

dialogues.speaker: BIRO
dialogues.text: That's just the beginning. As I develop my powers, I'll learn to bend space, too. Then I can tele-port myself anywhere on the planet.

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: Like Star Trek.

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: Yeah, like Star Trek. In every hero myth, the hero must learn his purpose. When he does, he will be tested and called to greatness. Ando stops in front of a karioki bar, considers this.

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: tI think I'm going to have to be drunk to finish this conversation. (heads towards bar) "Beam us up, Scotty". And he laughs as Hiro follows him into the bar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tt's been four and half minutes since Claire walked out o the fire. She sits on the tailgate, wrapped in a blanket.  37

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis” 12/2/05 38. A PARAMEDIC applies a SALVE to her face. That glazed look in her eyes is still there, The FIRE CHIEF steps up to he

dialogues.speaker: FIRE CHIEF
dialogues.text: You wanna tell me how you pulled that off? Claire shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: PIRE CHIEF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How'd you get to the second floor? There was no staircase anymore.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (deadpan, numb) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE CHIEF
dialogues.text: How'd you know where he was? (off her blank look) It's over eight hundred degrees in there. How the hell did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't know... And off her numb expression -- cuT TO;

dialogues.speaker: A DOORKNOB
dialogues.text: twists open. TILT UP to reveal Stella. She steps into the dark loft. Feels for the light switch. Finds it, flips it on. NOTHING. No Electricity.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Isaac! No answer. She walks cautiously into the room. Comes arou a corner and STOPS, as she sees something. It's Isaac. Lying on the floor, HANDCUFFED TO THE RADIATO He's shaking, convulsing in the THROES OF WITHDRAWAL. She stares at him, pissed and horrified all at once. He looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I should leave you here to die.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (weakly) Finally, something that makes sense.  3 HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I've got too many people dropping dead on me already. She bends down to him.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Get away from me.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: I'm taking you to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I said, leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Where's the key?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I don't have it,

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Where's the goddamn key?! Isaac just turns away. Stella, pissed, crosses to the kitchen, YANKS open the cupboard under the sink. Pulls ou a TOOLBOX. Carries it back and DROPS it on the floor. She opens it and digs around. Finds a HAMMER. Starts POUNDING the shit out of the chain of the handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: It's better this way. You'll forget about me after a while. Stella BANGS for a few seconds, then STOPS. It's FUTILE. She reaches into the toolbox and pulls out a SAW. She sta trying to cut the chain with it, but it’s a fucking WOOD SAW. She DROPS IT ON THE FLOOR in frustration. Starts digging through the toolbox for something else.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I never loved you, Stella. I wanted your money. JI wanted the sex. That’s all it was. Thought you should know that in case I die. Stella just stares at him, crushed by his words. She stan and looks down at him.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Fine. You wanna die? Die. I'm not gonna stop you. she turns and walks away. Isaac watches her until she ste out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 40. A long beat, then his conflicted eyes focus onto somethin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: five feet away - The SAW lies on the floor. We RACK FOCUS to it. Off Isaac's eyes, the seed planted for this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KEY unlocks a PRISON CELL DOOR. WIDEN to find D.L. bein PUSHED into a cell by the two Guards. This is an American version of "Midnight Express". It's fucked up. Depressing windowless, cold. Across the hali, ANOTHER CELL faces it. In here, EZEKIEL TAYLOR, an older black man in his sixties, watches. Wise but dangerous eyes. The Guards SHOVE D.L. in and lock the cell behind him.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: You keep an eye on him, zeke. This boy likes to wander. The Guards walk off, leaving D.L. and "Zeke" staring at o another across the hall. It's an awkward moment. Finally

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Musta done something real bad - get your ass thrown down here. D.L. just looks at him. Crosses and sits on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Quiet type. Good. {laughs to himself) Last dude talked too much anyway. zeke lifts some ROLLED UP OBJECT, two feet long. Carries to the center of his cell as he talks --

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Either you got nothing to say, OF... zeke stops and looks at him, studying his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You scared. Uh huh... I seen your kind in here thirty seven years now. He UNROLLS the object in his hand and we see that it's a PERSIAN PRAYER RUG.  HERCES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like every other swinging dick. Kill someone, rob the wrong white lady, end up looking at the world from the inside out. Till one day it dawns on your sorry ass that it's over, the so-called dream you call "life". Now, most men go one way when faced with that inevitability. Prison livin' inside you, ‘stead of the other way ‘round. He lays the PRAYER RUG down on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's a lotta ways a man can do the time. But ain't but one of them lead to the real way out. geke lifts a BOOK from the stool by his bed. Crosses to t bars and looks ominously at D.L. He whispers, as though revealing a secret ~-

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can teach your soul to go anywhere it wants. He bends down, places the book on the floor. SLIDES it ac the hall. It comes to a stop right outside D.L.'s cell.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Taught mine to go to Mecca five times a day. zeke turns and walks to the prayer rug, stands over it, obviously facing Mecca.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: the book) I know where to find you when I need it back. He raises his palms skyward. Mutters a prayer under his breath and drops to his knees, then prostrate onto the fl D.L. watches this odd ritual, then looks down at the book the floor. Stands and crosses to it. Picks it up. Looks at the cover. “The Koran" Off D.L., watching Zeke pray ~-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiro and Ando sit at a back table. They're a little tipsy now and have to SHOUT to be heard over the really BAD KAR Hiro is still all worked up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 42.

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: See, most people perceive time as a straight line, always going forward. Like this. Hiro dips a CHOPSTICK into his small dish of SOY SAUCE. H draws a soy sauce line on his paper place mat.

dialogues.speaker: HIRO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But time is actually more like this... He takes his finger and smears the soy sauce into a CIRCL

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: Where did you learn all this?

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: X-Men, issue 117, when Wolverine breaks into Professor Xavier's lair--

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: A comic book?

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: (duh...) Well... Yeah. There isn’t a ten year old on the planet who hasn't secretly wished for super powers. And I, Hiro Tanaka, got them. Me of all people. Last in my class, last on the sports field. I'm not a loser anymore. Ando considers this. Wow, his friend is really serious ab this shit.

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: Alright, look... Tell me one useful thing you could do with this power. Can you make money?

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: A super hero doesn't use his powers for personal gain.

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: Then what good is it? Can you tele- port yourself into the women's bathroom? Now, there's something useful. You won't learn your "purpose" in there, but you might learn something about life.

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: Fine. If I had to, yes, I could tele- port myself into the women's bathroom.  HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: Great, then do it. I'll grab two more beers. And Ando gets up, heads for the bar. Hiro watches him go, then turns his gaze towards the women's bathroom at the b of the bar. What the hell, he takes a deep breath and STA INTENSELY at the bathroom door. Off Hiro, concentrating hard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A static WIDE SHOT of Claire's family around a very norma middle class dinner table - very Kubrick. Claire, dressed now in jeans and a sweatshirt, sits with her mom, SANDRA, (41), dad, KENT, (43) and brother, LYLE, (14). Sandra is all wound up--

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: ...I think Carla is perfectly nice and very capable, but if they think I'm going to take orders from her... She looks up from her plate to see that no one is really paying that much attention.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It just gets my goat.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: It's understandable, sweetheart. You've been working checkout for fourteen years. I feel the same way about Ted.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Alright, enough about me. What'd everybody else do today? Kent looks to his two kids. Lyle just shrugs. Claire push her food around the plate.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: I sold a fully loaded LeBaron to a guy from Midland. Put thirty percent down. Three more cars and that trip to Maui is ours this year. Aloooha. (to Lyle) How'bout you, buddy? Anything happen today?

dialogues.speaker: LYLE
dialogues.text: Doug and I saw this Mexican guy, a homeless dude, on our way to school. We thought he was dead... But he wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis” 12/2/05 44. Kent just nods. Not exactly what he was hoping for, but. He and Sandra turn to Claire, expectantly. Without hesita

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I jumped off a cliff... and I didn't die. Dead silence as everyone looks at her, trying to figure o what that could possibly mean. Kent, doing his best to re

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: I know you're at that secretive age, sweetheart, but what do you mean by that? Claire, on the spot, hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: I know what she means. Claire looks at her, a mixture of fear and relief.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here I am talking about getting passed over for a silly little raise, and you go and say something really profound. We come to all kinds of cliffs in our lives. And when we face our fears and jump, we usually don't get hurt. (welling up) You're very wise, sweetheart. Whatever it is you did, I'm proud of you. Off Claire's tiny, forced smile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan climbs into back seat of the cab, stares out the wi up at the sky. The LIGHT has darkened from ECLIPSE, and w realize we are RIGHT where and when we last left him.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: (to 0.S. driver) The corner of Center and Canal, please. The taxi pulls away and Ethan stares out the window up to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: THE REAR VIEW MIRROR
dialogues.text: as a HAND reaches up to adjust it. In its REFLECTION we s Ethan from the driver's perspective. A voyeuristic moment as Ethan has no idea he‘s being spied upon.

dialogues.speaker: SURESH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A Solar Eclipse.  HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 Ethan looks up at the driver, It's PROFESSOR SURESH, look as anonymous as any other Third World cabbie in Manhattan

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. Wonder if it's gonna be total?

dialogues.speaker: SURESH
dialogues.text: Not here, no. Some other part of the world, yes. A true global event. Makes one appreciate how small our planet really is. Ethan looks at Suresh, intrigued by his observation.

dialogues.speaker: SURESH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But then, we are all rather small, aren't we? Ethan nods as he stares at Suresh. It's an odd stare, an instant and overwhelming need to open up this conversatio A perfect stranger, no strings. What's the harm?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: SURESH
dialogues.text: Mohinder.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: I'm Ethan. (beat) Let me ask you something, Mohinder. You ever have the feeling you were meant to do something extraordinary?

dialogues.speaker: SURESH
dialogues.text: I'm driving a cab. You may have noticed.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: I'm not talking about what you do. I'm talking about who you are. I'm talking about being special.

dialogues.speaker: SURESH
dialogues.text: We are all special.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: (frustrated) That's not what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: SURESH
dialogues.text: Some individuals, it is true, are more special. This is natural selection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interesting...) Like evolution.

dialogues.speaker: SURESH
dialogues.text: What is it that makes a species, after millions of years, suddenly adapt to catastrophic changes in their environment? Overnight. Literally. We PUSH IN on Ethan as Suresh continues. Ethan is riveted

dialogues.speaker: SURESH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The ice age hits and a hundred thousand species go extinct immediately. (snaps his fingers) Like that. While others, no more unique ox complex, change and adapt in extraordinary ways, insuring the survival of their species. The cockroach, for instance. We PUSH IN on Ethan as Suresh's lecture continues. Ethan riveted. This is speaking to the very core of his being.

dialogues.speaker: SURESH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It begins with a single individual, born or hatched like every other member of their species, Anonymous, seemingly ordinary. Except they're not. They carry inside them the genetic code that will take their species to the next evolutionary rung. Ethan is now staring off at nothing. Slowly nodding his head.

dialogues.speaker: SURESH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So if one feels they are special, that they have unique abilities, then they have an evolutionary imperative to discover those abilities. It's their destiny. Ethan swallows. He looks like he's about to leap out of h skin. No words have ever rung truer. And breaking this strange silence -~ RING, his cell, Ethan jumps, then answ

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: (to phone) Hello?... Stella... I was just going home, but... No, it's no problem. I can be there in ten minutes. That's okay, I'll see you there. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I get out here, please? Suresh studies him for a beat, then pulis the cab over. Ethan reaches into his pocket and pulls out a ten, drops through the window of the partition. He opens the door an starts to get out. Ethan holds his gaze for a beat, unable to speak. Then tu and rushes off. Suresh watches him as another MAN slides into the back seat. We do NOT see his face, but he is dre in a DARK SUIT. And for a split second we think we catch just a glimpse of his HORN RIMMED GLASSES. Suresh turns and looks at the man.

dialogues.speaker: SURESH
dialogues.text: Where to, my friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: é, CHAPTER FOUR: “Genesis” ; i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cs \ Me N.. é “How | learned to Stop worrying and Love the Bomb”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: CHAPTER FOUR
dialogues.text: “Genesis” or "How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON the luscious waves and folds of the BLUE SATIN BEDSPREAD that we saw when we first met Niki. They're disrupted as --

dialogues.speaker: WEASEL, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Fifty grand is a lot of money. Niki is thrown onto her bed. Violently. (Only a minute an fourteen seconds have passed since last we saw her.) She looks up at -- the WEASEL and the BIG GUY standing over h

dialogues.speaker: WEASEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But we wanna be fair about this.

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Fifty? It was thirty. Even with interest-—

dialogues.speaker: WEASEL
dialogues.text: Shoulda read the fine print. The Weasel pulls up a chair as the Big Guy checks out her computer and camera. Niki looks at them desperately --

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Look, I have a son. I'm all he's got. Please. I can get the money.

dialogues.speaker: WEASEL
dialogues.text: Tell you what, let's start with a little business proposition. You make, what, forty bucks every twenty minutes for taking off your clothes? Niki looks at them, unsure what he's getting at.

dialogues.speaker: WEASEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm gonna give you a chance to work off a little of your debt. See where it goes from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 vhe Big Guy hits the RECORD BUTTON on the camera. Niki lo at the red light on the camera. The SLOW WHIR of the TAPE TURNING echoes in the garage.

dialogues.speaker: WEASEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (leaning back) Go on, let's see what you got. Niki sits up on her knees on the bed and slowly, timidly begins to rub her hands seductively up and down her body. She starts to cry, but stops herself. Gets into character Undoes the buttons on her shirt -- starting at the top an working her way down. One by one. Slow as she can. The two men smile. And as she undoes the top button of he jeans -~ she STOPS. Looks at something just behind the tw men. They notice. Turn and look back behind them to see -

dialogues.speaker: NIKI'S REFLECTION
dialogues.text: din the MIRROR that we saw the first time we were here. Nothing unusual. They look back at Niki. But she keeps looking at her reflection.

dialogues.speaker: WEASEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's the problem, baby? It's just getting good. But Niki doesn't respond. She just keeps staring at the reflection. The Weasel is pissed. He stands, crosses to her, BACKHANDS her across the face.

dialogues.speaker: WEASEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said, what's your problem?! Niki gets back up. Scowls at him defiantly --

dialogues.speaker: NIKI
dialogues.text: Fuck you. The Weasel rears back and delivers a STRAIGHT HARD PUNCH. And as his fist comes RIGHT INTO CAMERA, we ~—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: professor Suresh looks back at the man with HORNED RIMMED GLASSES, waiting for him to respond. (We're right where w left off last time we were with Suresh.)

dialogues.speaker: HORNED RIMMED GLASSES
dialogues.text: The United Nations, please. Suresh turns and starts driving. After a long, tense beat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43  VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: HORNED RIMMED GLASSES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Suresh, huh? Suresh, startled, looks back over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: SURESH
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: HORNED RIMMED GLASSES
dialogues.text: Your name. On your license there. Suresh looks down at his LICENSE and PHOTO, displayed on dash. And now we get our first real look at the Man with the HO RIMMED GLASSES. A sort of young Max Von Sydow-type. Sophisticated, unknowable. He's toying with Suresh. He knows exactly who he is.

dialogues.speaker: HORNED RIMMED GLASSES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's Indian, yes? Suresh stares at him through his rear view mirror. Those GLASSES. He knows them. It lands. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: HORNED RIMMED GLASSES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (musing) Probably lots of Suresh's where your from. Like Smith or Anderso-- SKIIIDDDDD! The tires LOCK as Suresh SLAMS on the BRAKES. The Man goes FLYING into the plexiglas partition, SMASHIN his glasses against it. It stuns him. When he regains his bearings, he locks up to see Suresh is GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CRANE UP over the taxi, its driver's door wide open, a see Suresh SPRINTING down the middle of the street, weavi in and out of the traffic. And as Horned Rimmed Glasses slowly climbs out and watches him disappear into the dist

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ando stands at the bar. (About forty seconds of time has passed since we last saw them.) He takes two bottles of Asahi and turns back towards the table where he and Hiro were sitting. Hiro is gone. He sees a COMMOTION near the back of the place. A BOUNCER is dragging Hiro out of the women's bathroom as two WOMEN scream angrily at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ando watches the Bouncer drag Hiro right past him and out the front door, tossing him onto the sidewalk. Ando looks down at the beers in his hand, shakes his head and sets t down. He heads for the door.  HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiro lies in a heap on the sidewalk as Ando steps out the door.

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: {sore, but excited) Did you see me? I did it. I was in the women's bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: Great. Now you're a pervert.

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: {gets up slowly) I tele-ported myself!

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: Enough! There is NO SUCH THING as breaking the space/time continuum, alright?!

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: Fine, don't believe me.

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: There are twelve and a half million people in this city. Not one of them can bend space and time. Why do you want to be different?!

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: No. The question is, why do you want to be the same?!

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: Because, that's what I am! The same.

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: Exactly. It's what we all are. Look at us. We dress the same. We look the same. We do the same jobs. Just like everyone else. Homogeneous. Yogurt.

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: (now he's mad) Yogurt, huh? Last year at the company banquet, the whole department sang karioki. Madonna, Tears for Fears, Abba, Duran Duran... But who sang Barry White? Me. That's different enough.

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: Sure. For you. But I want to be special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: We are not special! We are Japanese!

dialogues.speaker: HIRO
dialogues.text: Fine. Stay here. Be just like everyone else. I wanna go boldly where no man has gone before. And he walks off. Ando watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: ANDO
dialogues.text: That's right, you’re special! You're “Super Hiro"! Go find your purpose! Go save the world! And as Hiro walks off into the night --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan enters, looks up to see Stella rifling through the drawers of the night stand by the bed where her father la dying. She looks a little crazed.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: What are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Morphine.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: What for? She stops. Looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: I need you to come with me someplace.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: You'll see. She grabs some VIALS and stuffs them inte her purse. Etha crosses to her. He's more confident and determined than w have ever seen him.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Look, I can’t work for your father anymore.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: (confused) What? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE “Genesis” 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: I can't, I need to make some changes in my life. I can't keep living for other people. I need to spread my wings, you know?

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: (snaps) We'll talk about this later! Right now I need you to come with me. You're a nurse, you can give a shot. You can help him.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Help who? But she doesn't answer, as she strides towards the door. Off Ethan, wondering what he's getting into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: zeke lies asleep in his bed. He stirs and opens his eyes. Sits up, as something gets his attention.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE HALL
dialogues.text: D.L. stands by the bars of his cell, a strange glazed loo on his face.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Somethin’ you want, brother? D.L. doesn't answer. Zeke stands and crosses to the bars his own cell. Stares at D.L., studies him.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay? Still no response from D.L., just the strange expression.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: {realizing) Damn... You're sleepwalking, ain't you? (then) Go back to bed. I'm serious. This ain't natural. Go back to bed. He waits to see if D.L. will comply. He doesn't. Zeke tur and walks back to bed. Climbs under the covers and rolls over, his back to D.L. Off D.L., standing near the bars, asleep on his feet -~

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire does dishes. Sandra is in the b.g., clearing the table in the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I thought we'd go to the movies this Saturday. Maybe try on some shoes at the new mall in Gardenville.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Sure. (then, out of the blue) I love you mom.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: But?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: But nothing. I just wanted to tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No, you think I'm trying to be your best friend again, admit it.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: It's alright, really, we can go to the movies together. It's no big deal. She turns on the GARBAGE DISPOSAL, scraps a plate of food into it.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (voice rising over noise) I just miss you, that’s all. I want to be your mom, I want to give you advice, but I don't want to push you away. Claire looks back towards her desperately, but Sandra's s in the other room, clearing the table.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I want advice. I do. I won't push you away, I promise. And just then, her CLASS RING slips off her finger and IN the disposal. Without thinking, Claire PLUNGES her hand i to retrieve it. The disposal WHIRS and GRINDS hideously a her fingers are GROUND in it. She pulls her hand out, and in her BLOODY, MANGLED FINGERS, she holds the RING. She stares at it, in no pain at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HERCES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: I just don't think you should be so worried about fitting in all the time, about being so popular. And Sandra comes back into the room. Claire turns quickly and hides her bloody hand behind her back, as Sandra step right up to her and takes her lovingly by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't want to see you make mistakes like I did. I wanted to be someone more interesting than I am.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You are interesting.

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR
dialogues.text: the BLOOD DRIPPING next to Claire's feet. DRIP.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: No, I wanted to hitchhike across Europe, study art, fall in love with some poetry quoting frenchmen. Not that your dad isn't wonderful, but my point is, you should be who you are and know that it's enough. Because who you are is special. Claire nods, looks into her mother's eyes. Wants to tell her.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: About that, mom... There's something I need to say. Something I haven't talked about because I thought it would upset you and dad.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Sweetheart, you can say anything to us, you know that.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (really hard to say} I think I'm old enough now for you to tell me who my real parents are. Well, we didn't see that one coming. Sandra looks at her, then pulls her into her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a Of course you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE “Genesis” 12/2/05 Claire instinctive hugs her back. She lifts her HAND and looks at it behind Sandra's back, It's PERFECTLY NORMAL now.

dialogues.speaker: KENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Honey?! Claire?! Come take a look at this! Claire and Sandra separate and head into -- INT. LIVING ROOM ~- CLAIRE'S HOUSE —- CONTINUOUS Where they find Kent standing in front of the TV. He's go his back to them, obscuring the TV from their view.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: (numbly) The news. HE steps aside and we see ON THE TV - the FOOTAGE from th FIRE. Claire is CARRYING THE BOY out of the burning build there for all the world to see this miraculous feat. Sandra and Kent both turn in unison to stare at Claire, speechless. Off Claire's enigmatic expression -- and one second before she is about to speak we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're IN REAL TIGHT on Niki's face, lying in a smear of h own blood on the BLUE SATIN BEDCOVER. She slowly wakes. Disoriented, she starts to sit up, wondering where the he she is. Then it hits her like a ton of bricks as she sees something and GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place looks like a fucking TORNADO RIPPED THROUGH IT. Our two bad guys, the WEASEL and the BIG GUY lay DEAD on floor. And I mean real DEAD. There's BLOOD everywhere. They've been SAVAGELY BEATEN. BROKEN MIRROR SHARDS are everywhere. One LARGE PIECE is sticking out of the Weasel's neck, his eyes still wide op The Big Guy's own gun is SHOVED into his MOUTH, a pool of BLOOD behind his head. Niki stands up and STAGGERS off the bed. She turns all th way around, totally freaked, looking for the unseen culpr of this insane KILLING SPREE. She backs up, stepping over the Big Guy's dead carcass an BUMPS INTO the webcam's tripod. Catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 Suddenly realizes that the camera's RED LIGHT is STILL ON It dawns on her in a flash. She shuts off the camera and unclips it from the tripod. Carrying it, she starts to tu when something catches her eye. Looking OVER HER SHOULDER from BEHIND her, we now see wha it is -- The BUSTED MIRROR, half the glass broken out of frame. In the mirror - HER OWN REFLECTION. She stares at herself in the cracked pieces of glass, dividing her like jigsaw puzzle. And suddenly, like something out of a freaky horror film, her REFLECTION MOVES, independent of her. It RAISES its blood drenched HAND and WIPES it nonchalantly on her shir And off Niki, her life suddenly upside down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're TIGHT ON D.L.'s FACE. Again, like when we first met him, he's asleep. Then CHA CHUNK! The unmistakable sound of a SHOTGUN COCKING. He wakes with a start. Looks up, eyes wide. ADJUST to see two GUARDS standing over him. We CRANE UP t discover that we are right outside the razor wired fence the prison. D.L. looks around, no idea how he got here. A we slowly RISE to find the MOON in the sky --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We TILT DOWN from that same MOON to find Hiro strolling d the empty sidewalk in this quiet business district. He we slightly from too much to drink, He passes a TRAVEL AGENC Stops and stares at his own reflection the window. Along with the various TRAVEL POSTERS on display, there i wall of CLOCKS displaying the different TIME ZONES around the world. He closes his eyes from fatigue, pinching the bridge of his nose. As he does, we see EVERY CLOCK begin SPIN wildly. He opens his eyes back up and they stop. He didn't notice He nonchalantly glances up at a poster of TIMES SQUARE in New York City, all lit up at night. He stares it, smiles and slowly turns to walk away. He ta a couple of steps and stops. A stunned look on his face. He stares up and all around him and we SLOWLY PULL BACK t find that Hiro is now standing smack in the middle of --

dialogues.speaker: TIMES SQUARE
dialogues.text: We RISE UP as Hiro spins around, taking in this extraordi sight and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Stella and Ethan enter the dark room, Stella has a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: I'm just saying it's impossible. No one can predict the future.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: I saw it with my own eyes. (yells) Isaac?! I brought someone to help you. He's a nurse. There's no response. Ethan follows behind her, but stops, as something CRUNCHES beneath his feet. She aims her ligh down. It's A SYRINGE. Ethan stares at it. Stella aims the light up towards the radiator that Isaac handcuffed himself to, He's NOT THERE. Closer now and she sees -~

dialogues.speaker: THE HANDCUFFS
dialogues.text: One cuff is still locked to the radiator. In the other cu a HAND, SAWED OFF at the WRIST,

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh god...

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Over there. Stella WHIPS the flashlight BEAM across the room to find

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: lying on the floor, unconscious, his bloody stump wrapped a towel. In his one hand, a paintbrush. Stella rushes up to him.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Jesus, Isaac, what have you done? But Ethan has come to a stop, He's seen something. We don see it yet, but it has stopped him dead in his tracks. Th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAINTING on an easel, half finished. It’s ETHAN! He's LEAPING OFF a building, wearing the same clothes he's wea right now, arms outstretched, like a swan dive. Ethan steps right up to the painting. Reaches out and tou his own image, suspended in mid-air.  HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: tends to Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm calling 911. We'll get you to a hospital. Isaac's eyes flutter open.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (barely audible) We have to stop it. And his eyes drift off, indicating something "over there" Stella follows his gaze and locks onto what he's looking

dialogues.speaker: THE WALL
dialogues.text: has been wildly PAINTED, like a crazy person on a psyched bender. Giant, bold brush strokes in half paint and half blood -- The image of a HUGE NUCLEAR MUSHROOM CLOUD risin over the skyline of New York City. Ethan, still frozen by his own image leaping off a buildi finally senses something and turns to see the huge painti on the wall. And as he takes it all in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close ON A PAIR OF SHOES DANGLING in mid-air. We RISE UP find Ethan sitting on the ledge of a fifteen story buildi legs over the side. He looks down, sees a TAXI pull up to the alley below. HARRISON hops out, rushes to the edge of the building, looks up at him, Ethan stands up on the led

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: (feigning nonchalance) I got your message! What are you doing here, Ethan?!

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Finding out who I am!

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: You know who you are! You're my brother! My better half! The nicest guy on the planet!

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: (welling up) Yeah! That's me! Or at least it used to be! I can fly, Harrison! I just need to do it! I need to take the leap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEROES VOLUME ONE "Genesis" 12/2/05

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: And if you can't?!

dialogues.speaker: ETBAN
dialogues.text: Then at least I’1l find out! I was born right next to you, I guess I'll die that way, too! Ethan steps closer to the edge.

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: Ethan, dammit, stop screwing around!

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: No. It's my turn to be somebody now! And he LEAPS off the ledge, arms outstretched, just like PAINTING! Like he can fly. But he doesn't... and he DROPS Actually, PLUMMETS is a better word. Like a stone! Fallin and flailing! Its awful. And just as we're convinced we'r about ot witness a horrible death -- He STOPS! In mid air It's like in the first dream. Except -- He looks down to see -~

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: HOLDING HIM UP, FLOATING IN MID-AIR himself! HE CAN FLY! They stare into each other's eyes, both as freaked by thi as the other.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You...$ How did you...?

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON
dialogues.text: I...I don't know. Ethan is heavy, and Harrison unsteady. He can't hold him up. Ethan SLIPS out of Harrison's arms! Harrison GRABS onto Ethan's HAND, suspending beneath him, dangling by th tips of his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: HARRISON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ethan... Oh god... A desperate beat, as they try to hold on.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: It's okay. I love you, Harrison. And as Ethan's fingers BEGIN TO SLIP, Harrison HOLDS ON f dear life, as we --
